thread.title: Fake news face-off: Trump & CNN in spat over POTUS comments… again
thread.title_full: Fake news face-off: Trump & CNN in spat over POTUS comments… again

author: RT
title: Fake news face-off: Trump & CNN in spat over POTUS comments… again
text:
— lawrence serewicz (@lldzne) February 12, 2017 This is just a lie @realDonaldTrump . Anyone who watched the video can see Bernie Sanders says "it was a joke" after that line. This is crazy — David G. McAfee (@DavidGMcAfee) February 12, 2017 
CNN didn’t let Trump’s tweet go unanswered, however, with the station’s PR department tweeting the president to say he was “false” as the interview did continue after a commercial break. 
“Transcript from @ErinBurnett intvu w @SenSanders. He was not cut off. Those are the facts,” a tweet from CNN’s Communications team read, providing a link to the interview’s transcript. Both CNN hosts Jake Tapper and Brian Stelter pulled Trump on his tweet too, with the latter stating that Trump’s comments were “untrue.” @realDonaldTrump False. Transcript from @ErinBurnett intvu w @SenSanders . He was not cut off. Those are the facts. https://t.co/NzJNgdYSIX pic.twitter.com/AOFKLHUlGk — CNN Communications (@CNNPR) February 12, 2017 Untrue. Sanders was *criticizing Trump* for calling CNN "fake news." You can see for yourself, all 11 minutes, here: https://t.co/qhtlb5Wo6Q https://t.co/AcwOiNHi0j — Brian Stelter (@brianstelter) February 12, 2017 From Michael Briggs, Senator Sanders’ Communications Director: “The Senator was clearly joking” https://t.co/OzMj8pkTlv — Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 12, 2017 
In a press conference in January, Trump branded CNN “disgraceful” before refusing to answer a question from Jim Acosta, one of the network's correspondents. “Be quiet. I’m not going to give you a question. You are fake news,” Trump said.
